body_html:
@soumith Unfortunately, this didn't solve the issue for me. If the problem is caused by linking, then wouldn't it manifest also with the normal python interpreter and not only with ipython?

To make sure that my Anaconda installation isn't messed up in some way, I made a fresh installation of Anaconda (version 5.0.1) and then installed pytorch (version 0.4.0). The problem remains (as before, only with ipython).

@Officium Here are the versions of the packages in the fresh Anaconda installation (mkl-fft is not installed):

intel-openmp              2018.0.0             h68bdfb3_7
libgfortran               3.0.1                h93005f0_2
mkl                       2018.0.0             h5ef208c_6
mkl-service               1.1.2            py36h7ea6df4_4
numpy                     1.13.3           py36h2cdce51_0

body:
@soumith Unfortunately, this didn't solve the issue for me. If the problem is caused by linking, then wouldn't it manifest also with the normal python interpreter and not only with ipython?

To make sure that my Anaconda installation isn't messed up in some way, I made a fresh installation of Anaconda (version 5.0.1) and then installed pytorch (version 0.4.0). The problem remains (as before, only with ipython). 

@Officium Here are the versions of the packages in the fresh Anaconda installation (mkl-fft is not installed):
```
intel-openmp              2018.0.0             h68bdfb3_7
libgfortran               3.0.1                h93005f0_2
mkl                       2018.0.0             h5ef208c_6
mkl-service               1.1.2            py36h7ea6df4_4
numpy                     1.13.3           py36h2cdce51_0
```
